credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
title: Design for Doorway, Possibly for Lobby or Vicinity South of Dining Room
medium: Watercolor, pen and ink on paper
description:
Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Design for a section of a wall with double doors decorated with a painted design of lattice-work. Above the doors a painted tablet bearing Chinese characters. The narrow panels on either side of the doors have painted designs of lattice-work, and narrow columns at ends of the wall.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory
name: Drawing
